question.title: error: Qualifier error. No method found annotated with @Named#value:mapClientInformation
question.body:
I am trying to migrate our API to Java 17 and Spring 6.2x version and I have some issue with the MapStruct. The qualifiedByName is recognized for some and other result in following error:

error: Qualifier error. No method found annotated with @Named#value: [ mapClientInformation ]. See https://mapstruct.org/faq/#qualifier for more info.

The version used is MapStruct 1.6.3:

<dependency>
    <groupId>org.mapstruct</groupId>
    <artifactId>mapstruct</artifactId>
    <version>${org.mapstruct.version}</version>
</dependency>

The mapper file:

@Mapper(componentModel = "spring", imports = {PhoneUtil.class, DateUtil.class})
public interface RequestMapper {
    @Mapping(target = "provider", source = "testRequestBody", qualifiedByName = "mapProvider")
    @Mapping(target = "entities", source = "testRequestBody", qualifiedByName = "mapEntities")
    EncryptedInstrument toDecryptedRequest(TestRequestBody testRequestBody);

    @Named("mapEntities")
    default List<Entity> mapEntities(TestRequestBody testRequestBody) {
        return Collections.singletonList(mapEntity(testRequestBody));
    }


    @Named("mapEntity")
    ........


    @Named("mapProvider")
    @Mapping(target = "issuerClientInformation", source = "testRequestBody", qualifiedByName = "mapClientInformation")
    EncryptedInstrumentProvider mapProvider(TestRequestBody testRequestBody);


    @Named("mapClientInformation")
    @Mapping(target = "source", constant = "ISSUER")
    ClientInformation mapClientInformation(TestRequestBody testRequestBody);
}

Please let me know why is it throwing error only for mapClientInformation and not for any other qualifiedByName.

question_comments.body: By experience, this thing happens most often when you accidentally import the wrong @Named annotation. Make sure it's org.mapstruct.Named and not the Jakarta one.

You can check what kind of mapping mapstruct generates without qualifiedByName. Then you can copy the mapping method declaration and use it here. Maybe there is a typo? Or accidentaly you have imported a class from another package with same name?
